result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel L Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joel L Hill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joel L Hill was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel L Hill

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 3 (MISDEMEANOR):  COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed the Defendant for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions as to probation:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable case finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, and the balance due prior to the end of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Participate in any anger management courses and cooperate fully.
*  No contact with KVP.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimens (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing; and you may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.

Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Counts 1 and 2 DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNT 3 (Misdemeanor):   Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Joel L Hill in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 3:  On motion of the State Court AMENDED Count 3 from Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Harm (Felony)  TO  Battery under Wisconsin Stats. 940.19(1) a Class a Misdemeanor.  Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Joel L Hill in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Received offer.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

ADA Schindhelm is unable to appear. Case calendared for scheduling of a jury trial date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Joel L Hill in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Cindy Davis for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State was going to move to dismiss as they thought their witness had not appeared. ADA Schindhelm had a family emergency and ADA Davis is unprepared to proceed to trial. Parties stipulate to an adjournment to pick a trial date.  Court ordered case adjourned for a scheduling conference in Branch 7.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Clerk:  jms  Jury trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Parties stipulate to adjourning the final pretrial for further negotiations as case may resolve in lieu of trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joel L Hill in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Michael Thurston for Michael Schindhelm for Christopher Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received and offer from the State. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requested an additional scheduling date. The Court denied the defense request, and final pre-trial and jury trial dates were selected.   Parties to file motions by 06/18/2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Parties advised as of 8/01/2015 this case will be assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07 in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.`
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Joel L Hill in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Ronald Dague for Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:George Simonson-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/11/15.

15RM022469  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/27/2015

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case called on Court's own motion regarding DNA sample.  Defense waives Defendant's appearance for this date only.  Court finds this case is NOT required to have a DNA sample at arrest.  Court RESCINDS order requiring the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KVP dob 03/16/02

Defendant Joel L Hill in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Joel L Hill in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 1 & 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
